boat.construction_details: GRP hull, Mahogany and Iroko interior

for_sales.sales_text: 1995 Kittiwake 14 Yawl ‘Selene’ Built for Alastair Dickenson (from the Antiques Roadshow)  Professionally refitted in 2022. GRP simulated clinker hull with grey gel coat topsides  2021 Coppercoat antifoul applied by Berthon Boat Company  Mahogany interior  Iroko planked foredeck  Canadian pine masts & spars  Davey & co Bronze cleats and fairleads  Leather fittings (bow sprit ring traveller, outboard pad etc)  Bronze and copper fastenings throughout  Wykeham Martin bronze furling gear  Tufnol blocks Bronze rowlocks with 8ft long wooden oars, stored under benches    New running rigging made in 2022 (double braid sheets, 3-strand halyards with bronze snap shackles)  Stainless standing rigging  Gaff main mast (option for topsail)  Sloop mizzen mast  Mouse Tan sails (mizzen, main, staysail, jib)  New Jeckells cream flying jib  She can fly 3 headsails at once!    Watertight forward and aft bulkheads  Lifting galvanised centre plate in mahogany centre box  Forward watertight bow locker with iroko planked hatch  Boat was fully varnished last summer.    New 2023 custom, overall winter boat cover Strengthened transom with leather pad designed to carry 3-4hp long shaft outboard. (outboard not included) Recently serviced R.M Trailers break-back roller road trailer I have sailed her all over the Solent.  Done a few Solent Old Gaffer events.  A real head turner of a Yawl. Much admired.  I would love to hang on to her, as she’s a stunning boat, but I’ve now bought a classic yacht project and there aren’t enough hours in the day!!

boat.full_description:
Hull 17 was built in 1995 by Roger Wilkinson for Alastair Dickenson, the silver expert on the Antiques Roadshow.

She has been cruised in the Lake District and on the Solent for the past 20 years with no name.

Her current owner bought her in 2021 and set about naming her, replacing all of the running rigging, re-caulking the deck, coppercoating the hull, repainting the transom and re-varnishing all of the spars.

He wasnt looking at buying a boat but couldnt resist her mahogany interior and Davey bronze fittings.

'Selene' will be present a many OGA events and raced throughout the Solent.
boat.name: Selene
